hermetic_principles.description: The seven fundamental principles of Hermetic philosophy as applied to tarot interpretation
hermetic_principles.quote: The principles of truth are seven; he who knows these, understandingly, possesses the magic key before whose touch all the doors of the temple fly open.
hermetic_principles.author: The Three Initiates

mentalism.principle: The All is Mind; the Universe is Mental
mentalism.tarot_application: All tarot readings reflect the mental state and consciousness of the querent
mentalism.practical_meaning: Thoughts create reality and influence outcomes
mentalism.quote: Mind is the master power that moulds and makes, and man is mind, and evermore he takes the tool of thought, and, shaping what he wills, brings forth a thousand joys, a thousand ills.
mentalism.author: James Allen

correspondence.principle: As above, so below; as below, so above
correspondence.tarot_application: Patterns in the cards reflect patterns in life and cosmos
correspondence.practical_meaning: Microcosm reflects macrocosm in all divination
correspondence.quote: That which is below is like that which is above, and that which is above is like that which is below, to accomplish the miracles of the one thing.
correspondence.author: Hermes Trismegistus

vibration.principle: Nothing rests; everything moves; everything vibrates
vibration.tarot_application: Each card carries specific vibrational frequencies
vibration.practical_meaning: Energy states can be shifted through conscious intention
vibration.quote: If you want to find the secrets of the universe, think in terms of energy, frequency and vibration.
vibration.author: Nikola Tesla

polarity.principle: Everything is dual; everything has poles; opposites are identical in nature
polarity.tarot_application: All cards contain both positive and negative potentials
polarity.practical_meaning: Understanding polarity allows for conscious choice
polarity.quote: Opposites are identical in nature, but different in degree; extremes meet; all truths are but half-truths.
polarity.author: The Three Initiates

rhythm.principle: Everything flows, out and in; the pendulum-swing manifests in everything
rhythm.tarot_application: Card meanings change with life cycles and timing
rhythm.practical_meaning: Life moves in cycles of expansion and contraction
rhythm.quote: To everything there is a season, and a time to every purpose under heaven.
rhythm.author: Ecclesiastes

cause_and_effect.principle: Every cause has its effect; every effect has its cause
cause_and_effect.tarot_application: Card combinations show karmic patterns and consequences
cause_and_effect.practical_meaning: Present situations result from past choices
cause_and_effect.quote: The law of karma is the law of cause and effect in the moral world.
cause_and_effect.author: Swami Vivekananda

gender.principle: Everything has its masculine and feminine principles
gender.tarot_application: All cards express both active and receptive energies
gender.practical_meaning: Balance of masculine and feminine creates harmony
gender.quote: The masculine and feminine principles exist in all planes of creation.
gender.author: The Three Initiates

alchemical_operations.description: The twelve classical alchemical operations and their correspondence to tarot transformation
alchemical_operations.quote: Alchemy is the art of transmuting base metals into gold, but more importantly, it is the art of transmuting the base human soul into spiritual gold.
alchemical_operations.author: Paracelsus

calcination.psychological_process: Burning away ego attachments and false beliefs
calcination.spiritual_meaning: Destruction of illusions to reveal truth
calcination.quote: The first operation of the Great Work is the calcination of the base metal, representing the burning away of all that is false in human nature.
calcination.author: Manly P. Hall
calcination.source: The Secret Teachings of All Ages

solution.spiritual_meaning: Liquefying the solid ego to allow transformation
solution.practical_application: Becoming more flexible and open to change
solution.quote: Solution dissolves the fixed into the flowing, allowing the rigid boundaries of the ego to become permeable to divine influence.
solution.author: Carl Jung

separation.spiritual_meaning: Separating the pure from the impure
separation.quote: Separation is the operation by which we learn to distinguish between what belongs to our true nature and what is merely superficial conditioning.
separation.author: A.E. Waite

conjunction.quote: Conjunction is the mystical marriage where opposites are united in perfect harmony, creating something greater than the sum of its parts.
conjunction.author: Marie-Louise von Franz
conjunction.source: Alchemy: An Introduction to the Symbolism and the Psychology

putrefaction.psychological_process: Allowing old self to die completely
putrefaction.practical_application: Accepting loss and grief as transformation
putrefaction.quote: Without putrefaction, nothing can be regenerated. The old must completely die before the new can be born.
putrefaction.author: Basil Valentine
putrefaction.source: The Twelve Keys of Basil Valentine

congelation.quote: Congelation fixes the volatile spirit into stable form, making permanent what was once fleeting inspiration.
congelation.author: Nicholas Flamel

cibation.quote: Cibation is the gentle nourishment of the philosophical child, providing it with the spiritual food necessary for its growth.
cibation.author: Ramon Llull

sublimation.psychological_process: Elevating base instincts to higher expression
sublimation.spiritual_meaning: Transformation of lower nature into higher
sublimation.practical_application: Channeling raw energy into creative expression
sublimation.quote: Sublimation raises the earthly to the celestial, transforming base desires into divine inspiration.
sublimation.author: Zosimos of Panopolis
sublimation.bodily_correspondence: Transmutation of sexual energy into creativity

fermentation.practical_application: Trusting the natural process of growth
fermentation.quote: Fermentation is the resurrection phase where the philosopher's stone begins to manifest its miraculous properties.
fermentation.author: George Ripley

exaltation.quote: Exaltation lifts the prepared soul to the heights of divine consciousness where it beholds the face of the eternal.
exaltation.author: John Dee

multiplication.quote: Multiplication demonstrates the infinite creative power of the perfected consciousness to generate limitless spiritual wealth.
multiplication.author: Michael Maier

projection.practical_application: Becoming a force for positive change
projection.quote: Projection is the final operation where the adept becomes a philosopher's stone, capable of transmuting all they touch.
projection.author: Pseudo-Democritus

prima_materia.description: The first matter from which all things are created
prima_materia.quote: The prima materia is the chaos mentioned by the ancients, containing in potential all forms and all possibilities.
prima_materia.author: Gerhard Dorn

characteristics.universal_solvent: Dissolves all forms back to pure potential
characteristics.dragon: The powerful force that must be tamed
characteristics.green_lion: The raw life force before refinement

tarot_correspondences.meaning: The unformed consciousness at the beginning of the journey

tarot_correspondences.aspect: The naked truth of essential nature
tarot_correspondences.meaning: Pure essence stripped of all artifice

prima_materia.psychological_meaning: The original nature before ego conditioning
prima_materia.spiritual_significance: The divine spark within all beings
prima_materia.practical_application: Returning to authentic self through spiritual practice

philosopher_stone.description: The ultimate goal of alchemy - the perfected consciousness
philosopher_stone.quote: The philosopher's stone is not a stone at all, but the perfect soul that has achieved union with the divine.
philosopher_stone.author: Paracelsus

properties.healing: Cures all diseases and extends life

nigredo.quote: In the blackness of nigredo, all illusions die and the soul confronts its shadow.

albedo.quote: The white queen emerges from the darkness, pure and receptive to divine light.

citrinitas.quote: The yellow phase brings the dawn of spiritual understanding and inner illumination.

rubedo.quote: The red king represents the perfected consciousness that has achieved the Great Work.

philosopher_stone.tarot_completion: The World card represents the achieved philosopher's stone
philosopher_stone.spiritual_significance: Christ consciousness or Buddha nature realized
philosopher_stone.practical_application: Living as an embodiment of divine wisdom and love

alchemical_symbols.description: Sacred symbols used in hermetic and alchemical practice
alchemical_symbols.quote: Symbols are the language of the soul, speaking directly to the unconscious mind through archetypal imagery.
alchemical_symbols.author: Carl Jung

hermetic_texts.description: Classical hermetic literature and their tarot applications

emerald_tablet.author: Hermes Trismegistus
emerald_tablet.tarot_application: The principle underlying all divinatory correspondence
emerald_tablet.quote: That which is below is like that which is above, and that which is above is like that which is below, to accomplish the miracles of the one thing.
emerald_tablet.practical_meaning: All tarot readings reflect cosmic patterns

corpus_hermeticum.author: Hermes Trismegistus
corpus_hermeticum.tarot_application: The mental nature of all tarot interpretation
corpus_hermeticum.quote: Mind is the pilot of the soul, and mind, being the image of God, governs all things.
corpus_hermeticum.practical_meaning: Consciousness shapes the meaning of cards

kybalion.author: The Three Initiates
kybalion.quote: The lips of wisdom are closed, except to the ears of understanding.
kybalion.practical_meaning: Tarot wisdom reveals itself according to the reader's level of understanding

alchemical_marriage.description: The sacred union of opposites in hermetic philosophy
alchemical_marriage.quote: The alchemical marriage is the union of the solar and lunar consciousness, creating the philosophical child of perfect wisdom.
alchemical_marriage.author: Gerhard Dorn

courtship.meaning: Conscious and unconscious begin to recognize each other

betrothal.meaning: Formal dedication to inner integration work

wedding.process: Active joining of masculine and feminine principles

spagyric_principles.description: The three principles of Paracelsian alchemy
spagyric_principles.quote: All things consist of three principles: Sulphur, Mercury, and Salt. These are the trinity that manifests in all creation.
spagyric_principles.author: Paracelsus

sulphur.meaning: The essential nature and driving force

mercury.meaning: The life force that animates and connects

salt.meaning: The physical vessel and material expression
